card.name: Accumulated Knowledge
card.ability: Draw a card, then draw cards equal to the number of cards named Accumulated Knowledge in all graveyards.
card.flavor:
"I have seen and heard much here. There are secrets within secrets. Let me show you."
—Takara, to Eladamri
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The count does not include the card that is currently resolving. The card does not go to the graveyard until after it is done resolving.

card.name: Æther Barrier
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a creature spell, that player sacrifices a permanent unless he or she pays {1}.
card.flavor:
"Creatures fade in and out of existence. It's an unfortunate side effect. The losses are tolerable."
—Belbe

card.name: Air Bladder
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
Enchanted creature can block only creatures with flying.
card.flavor: Random mutations among Rootwater merfolk were common—and disturbing.

card.name: Ancient Hydra
card.ability:
Fading 5 (This creature enters the battlefield with five fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
{1}, Remove a fade counter from Ancient Hydra: Ancient Hydra deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

card.name: Angelic Favor
card.ability:
If you control a Plains, you may tap an untapped creature you control rather than pay Angelic Favor's mana cost.
Cast Angelic Favor only during combat.
Put a 4/4 white Angel creature token with flying onto the battlefield. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.

card.name: Animate Land
card.ability: Until end of turn, target land becomes a 3/3 creature that's still a land.
card.flavor: Irony is getting walked on by the earth instead of the other way around.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Arc Mage
card.ability: {2}{R}, {T}, Discard a card: Arc Mage deals 2 damage divided as you choose among one or two target creatures and/or players.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can't choose zero targets. You must choose between 1 and 2 targets.

card.name: Ascendant Evincar
card.ability:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Other black creatures get +1/+1.
Nonblack creatures get -1/-1.
card.flavor:
"Things are going to change around here."
—Crovax
card.ruling: 7/15/2007 : If Ascendant Evincar stops being black, it gives itself -1/-1.

card.name: Avenger en-Dal
card.ability: {2}{W}, {T}, Discard a card: Exile target attacking creature. Its controller gains life equal to its toughness.

card.name: Battlefield Percher
card.ability:
Flying
Battlefield Percher can block only creatures with flying.
{1}{B}: Battlefield Percher gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

card.name: Belbe's Armor
card.ability: {X}, {T}: Target creature gets -X/+X until end of turn.
card.flavor: It protects her from the ravages of Phyrexia and the savages of Rath.

card.name: Belbe's Percher
card.ability:
Flying
Belbe's Percher can block only creatures with flying.
card.flavor: Long and powerful, these birds were used to carry messages to and from the evincar.

card.name: Belbe's Portal
card.ability:
As Belbe's Portal enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
{3}, {T}: You may put a creature card of the chosen type from your hand onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: The fight will continue on a new battlefield.

card.name: Blastoderm
card.ability:
Shroud (This permanent can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Fading 3 (This creature enters the battlefield with three fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)

card.name: Blinding Angel
card.ability:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever Blinding Angel deals combat damage to a player, that player skips his or her next combat phase.
card.flavor: "Their eyes will shrivel and blacken before faith's true light."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If you are damaged by more than one, the effects are cumulative and you skip multiple combat phases.

card.name: Bola Warrior
card.ability: {R}, {T}, Discard a card: Target creature can't block this turn.
card.flavor: The ingredients for panic include equal parts danger, uncertainty, and helplessness.

card.name: Carrion Wall
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{1}{B}: Regenerate Carrion Wall.
card.flavor: A wall built from the bodies of the enemy will never lack building material in times of war.

card.name: Chieftain en-Dal
card.ability: Whenever Chieftain en-Dal attacks, attacking creatures gain first strike until end of turn.
card.flavor: The clearest commands are practical examples.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Chieftain en-Dal does give itself first strike when attacking.

card.name: Cloudskate
card.ability:
Flying
Fading 3 (This creature enters the battlefield with three fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)

card.name: Coiling Woodworm
card.ability: Coiling Woodworm's power is equal to the number of Forests on the battlefield.
card.flavor: Only the elves know where the woods end and the woodworm begins.

card.name: Complex Automaton
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control seven or more permanents, return Complex Automaton to its owner's hand.
card.flavor:
"This wasteful design cannot possibly be Phyrexian."
—Belbe

card.name: Dark Triumph
card.ability:
If you control a Swamp, you may sacrifice a creature rather than pay Dark Triumph's mana cost.
Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: All that's left is the coronation.

card.name: Daze
card.ability:
You may return an Island you control to its owner's hand rather than pay Daze's mana cost.
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.

card.name: Death Pit Offering
card.ability:
When Death Pit Offering enters the battlefield, sacrifice all creatures you control.
Creatures you control get +2/+2.
card.flavor:
"Kill them all and feed them to the new recruits."
—Crovax

card.name: Defender en-Vec
card.ability:
Fading 4 (This creature enters the battlefield with four fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Remove a fade counter from Defender en-Vec: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

card.name: Defiant Falcon
card.ability:
Flying
{4}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with converted mana cost 3 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This card is both a Rebel and a Bird.
10/4/2004 : You do not have to find a Rebel card if you do not want to.

card.name: Defiant Vanguard
card.ability:
When Defiant Vanguard blocks, at end of combat, destroy it and all creatures it blocked this turn.
{5}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with converted mana cost 4 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You do not have to find a Rebel card if you do not want to.

card.name: Divining Witch
card.ability: {1}{B}, {T}, Discard a card: Name a card. Exile the top six cards of your library. Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal the named card, then put that card into your hand. Exile all other cards revealed this way.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You name a card during resolution of the ability.

card.name: Dominate
card.ability: Gain control of target creature with converted mana cost X or less. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
card.flavor:
"I've come to reclaim what is mine. And you, Greven, are mine."
—Volrath

card.name: Downhill Charge
card.ability:
You may sacrifice a Mountain rather than pay Downhill Charge's mana cost.
Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of Mountains you control.

card.name: Ensnare
card.ability:
You may return two Islands you control to their owner's hand rather than pay Ensnare's mana cost.
Tap all creatures.
card.flavor: Rootwater has become as dangerous to its denizens as to its enemies.

card.name: Eye of Yawgmoth
card.ability: {3}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Reveal a number of cards from the top of your library equal to the sacrificed creature's power. Put one into your hand and exile the rest.

card.name: Fanatical Devotion
card.ability: Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate target creature.
card.flavor: The Oracle told Eladamri he would save his people by abandoning them. His followers adopted that ideal.

card.name: Flame Rift
card.ability: Flame Rift deals 4 damage to each player.
card.flavor: Crovax hungered for power, and the stronghold devoured the sky.

card.name: Flint Golem
card.ability: Whenever Flint Golem becomes blocked, defending player puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

card.name: Flowstone Armor
card.ability:
You may choose not to untap Flowstone Armor during your untap step.
{3}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/-1 for as long as Flowstone Armor remains tapped.

card.name: Flowstone Crusher
card.ability: {R}: Flowstone Crusher gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Someone must have done something very bad to make a rock that angry."
—Rebel scout
card.ruling: 8/1/2005 : Flowstone Crusher's ability can be activated multiple times, but Flowstone Crusher is put into the graveyard after an effect resolves that makes its toughness 0.

card.name: Flowstone Overseer
card.ability: {R}{R}: Target creature gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: The rebels couldn't see where the roar was coming from. Then they saw it was coming from everywhere.

card.name: Flowstone Slide
card.ability: All creatures get +X/-X until end of turn.
card.flavor: It may look like soil, but its nature is malice.

card.name: Flowstone Strike
card.ability: Target creature gets +1/-1 and gains haste until end of turn.
card.flavor: Aggression exacts its toll.

card.name: Flowstone Surge
card.ability: Creatures you control get +1/-1.
card.flavor: The army was never at a loss for weapons; Crovax was their forge.

card.name: Flowstone Thopter
card.ability: {1}: Flowstone Thopter gets +1/-1 and gains flying until end of turn.
card.flavor: Airborne flowstone isn't less dangerous, only less common.

card.name: Flowstone Wall
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{R}: Flowstone Wall gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: The rebels assaulted the wall, never suspecting the wall would assault back.

card.name: Fog Patch
card.ability:
Cast Fog Patch only during the declare blockers step.
Attacking creatures become blocked. (This spell works on unblockable creatures.)
card.flavor: Realizing they weren't getting past the fog, the elves did the only thing they could do: wait.

card.name: Harvest Mage
card.ability: {G}, {T}, Discard a card: Until end of turn, if you tap a land for mana, it produces one mana of a color of your choice instead of any other type and amount.
card.flavor: "Why should one limit oneself to the resources at hand?"

card.name: Infiltrate
card.ability: Target creature is unblockable this turn.
card.flavor: Getting in was the easy part. Getting out proved to be more difficult.

card.name: Jolting Merfolk
card.ability:
Fading 4 (This creature enters the battlefield with four fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Remove a fade counter from Jolting Merfolk: Tap target creature.

card.name: Kill Switch
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Tap all other artifacts. They don't untap during their controllers' untap steps for as long as Kill Switch remains tapped.
card.flavor: Success is largely a matter of knowing which lever to pull.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Note that you can't choose to leave this card tapped during your untap step (unless some other effect says so).
10/4/2004 : Only the artifacts that it tried to tap when the ability resolved are prevented from untapping. Artifacts that enter the battlefield after that or permanents that become artifacts after that are not affected.

card.name: Kor Haven
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}{W}, {T}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target attacking creature this turn.

card.name: Laccolith Grunt
card.ability: Whenever Laccolith Grunt becomes blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, Laccolith Grunt assigns no combat damage this turn.
card.flavor: They leave a trail of ash and sorrow.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The ability triggers even if a spell or ability makes it blocked, instead of being blocked by a creature.
10/4/2004 : It can target any creature on the battlefield, not just one of the ones blocking it.
10/4/2004 : The ability allows you to deal damage during the declare blockers step of combat, which is well before even first strike creatures deal damage.
10/4/2004 : The ability is optional. You can decide to allow it to deal combat damage as normal.

card.name: Laccolith Rig
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature becomes blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, the first creature assigns no combat damage this turn.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If placed on a Laccolith creature, both this card's ability and the Laccolith's ability will trigger and have their effect.
10/4/2004 : If this is on an opponent's creature, the controller of this card (not the creature's controller) decides whether to use this card's ability or not, and decides what the target will be.
10/4/2004 : The ability triggers even if a spell or ability makes it blocked, instead of being blocked by a creature.
10/4/2004 : It can target any creature on the battlefield, not just one of the ones blocking it.
10/4/2004 : The ability allows you to deal damage during the declare blockers step of combat, which is well before even first strike creatures deal damage.
10/4/2004 : The ability is optional. You can decide to allow it to deal combat damage as normal.
10/15/2006 : Moving the enchantment after the ability triggers will not affect which creatures are affected.

card.name: Laccolith Titan
card.ability: Whenever Laccolith Titan becomes blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, Laccolith Titan assigns no combat damage this turn.
card.flavor: Proximity guarantees injury or death.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The ability triggers even if a spell or ability makes it blocked, instead of being blocked by a creature.
10/4/2004 : It can target any creature on the battlefield, not just one of the ones blocking it.
10/4/2004 : The ability allows you to deal damage during the declare blockers step of combat, which is well before even first strike creatures deal damage.
10/4/2004 : The ability is optional. You can decide to allow it to deal combat damage as normal.

card.name: Laccolith Warrior
card.ability: Whenever Laccolith Warrior becomes blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, Laccolith Warrior assigns no combat damage this turn.
card.flavor: The screams are brief. The silence lingers.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The ability triggers even if a spell or ability makes it blocked, instead of being blocked by a creature.
10/4/2004 : It can target any creature on the battlefield, not just one of the ones blocking it.
10/4/2004 : The ability allows you to deal damage during the declare blockers step of combat, which is well before even first strike creatures deal damage.
10/4/2004 : The ability is optional. You can decide to allow it to deal combat damage as normal.

card.name: Laccolith Whelp
card.ability: Whenever Laccolith Whelp becomes blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, Laccolith Whelp assigns no combat damage this turn.
card.flavor: They don't feed; they stoke.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The ability triggers even if a spell or ability makes it blocked, instead of being blocked by a creature.
10/4/2004 : It can target any creature on the battlefield, not just one of the ones blocking it.
10/4/2004 : The ability allows you to deal damage during the declare blockers step of combat, which is well before even first strike creatures deal damage.
10/4/2004 : The ability is optional. You can decide to allow it to deal combat damage as normal.

card.name: Lashknife
card.ability:
If you control a Plains, you may tap an untapped creature you control rather than pay Lashknife's mana cost.
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has first strike.
card.flavor: Those it won't scare, it scars.

card.name: Lawbringer
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Lawbringer: Exile target red creature.
card.flavor:
One injustice starts a thousand riots. One law stops a thousand crimes.
—Lawbringer creed

card.name: Lightbringer
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Lightbringer: Exile target black creature.
card.flavor:
One thought opens a thousand eyes. One sun brings a thousand dawns.
—Lightbringer creed

card.name: Lin Sivvi, Defiant Hero
card.ability:
{X}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with converted mana cost X or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
{3}: Put target Rebel card from your graveyard on the bottom of your library.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You do not have to find a Rebel card if you do not want to.

card.name: Mana Cache
card.ability:
At the beginning of each player's end step, put a charge counter on Mana Cache for each untapped land that player controls.
Remove a charge counter from Mana Cache: Add {1} to your mana pool. Any player may activate this ability but only during his or her turn before the end step.

card.name: Massacre
card.ability:
If an opponent controls a Plains and you control a Swamp, you may cast Massacre without paying its mana cost.
All creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn.

card.name: Mind Slash
card.ability: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
card.flavor: "I can't think with all that screaming."

card.name: Mind Swords
card.ability:
If you control a Swamp, you may sacrifice a creature rather than pay Mind Swords's mana cost.
Each player exiles two cards from his or her hand.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The active player chooses two cards, then the other player chooses two cards, then all the chosen cards are exiled simultaneously.

card.name: Mogg Alarm
card.ability:
You may sacrifice two Mountains rather than pay Mogg Alarm's mana cost.
Put two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: They make mountains into mogg holes.

card.name: Mogg Salvage
card.ability:
If an opponent controls an Island and you control a Mountain, you may cast Mogg Salvage without paying its mana cost.
Destroy target artifact.
card.flavor: Three moggs, one treasure, too bad.

card.name: Mogg Toady
card.ability:
Mogg Toady can't attack unless you control more creatures than defending player.
Mogg Toady can't block unless you control more creatures than attacking player.

card.name: Moggcatcher
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Search your library for a Goblin permanent card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: "They're not worth much, but they're easy to catch."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Mossdog
card.ability: Whenever Mossdog becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, put a +1/+1 counter on Mossdog.
card.flavor: The more you look at it, the more dangerous it becomes.

card.name: Murderous Betrayal
card.ability: {B}{B}, Pay half your life, rounded up: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor: In darkness, the assassin sneaked into the village and destroyed what Eladamri loved most: his daughter.

card.name: Nesting Wurm
card.ability:
Trample
When Nesting Wurm enters the battlefield, you may search your library for up to three cards named Nesting Wurm, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

card.name: Netter en-Dal
card.ability: {W}, {T}, Discard a card: Target creature can't attack this turn.
card.flavor: The wizard's vocabulary of mogg profanities increased with every net she cast.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The ability only does something if used before attackers are declared during a turn. If used after the creature is declared as an attacker, nothing happens.

card.name: Noble Stand
card.ability: Whenever a creature you control blocks, you gain 2 life.
card.flavor: Soldiers will always endanger their lives to defend many other lives.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Triggers once per creature you have that blocks. Does not trigger multiple times when a single creature blocks more than one attacker.

card.name: Off Balance
card.ability: Target creature can't attack or block this turn.
card.flavor: A heavy weapon deals plenty of damage—but it does have to hit.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The ability only does something if used before attackers or blockers (as appropriate) are declared during a turn. If used after the creature is declared as an attacker or blocker, nothing happens.

card.name: Oracle's Attendants
card.ability: {T}: All damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn by a source of your choice is dealt to Oracle's Attendants instead.
card.flavor: The future isn't sacred, but its speaker is.

card.name: Oraxid
card.ability: Protection from red
card.flavor:
"I'm constantly amazed by the tenacity of living creatures on this plane. Even in the stronghold's white-hot core, life persists."
—Ertai

card.name: Overlaid Terrain
card.ability:
As Overlaid Terrain enters the battlefield, sacrifice all lands you control.
Lands you control have "{T}: Add two mana of any one color to your mana pool."
card.flavor: One must reap before one can sow.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You sacrifice your lands right before this card enters the battlefield. There is no way to tap your lands using the 2-mana ability before they are sacrificed.

card.name: Pack Hunt
card.ability: Search your library for up to three cards with the same name as target creature, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: The one you see is just a diversion.

card.name: Pale Moon
card.ability: Until end of turn, if a player taps a nonbasic land for mana, it produces colorless mana instead of any other type.
card.flavor: Denizens of Rath had never seen the moon before. It was a symbol of change, not constancy.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The ability does not change the amount of mana produced, only the color.

card.name: Parallax Dementia
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Fading 1 (This enchantment enters the battlefield with one fade counter on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Enchanted creature gets +3/+2.
When Parallax Dementia leaves the battlefield, destroy enchanted creature. That creature can't be regenerated.

card.name: Parallax Inhibitor
card.ability: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Parallax Inhibitor: Put a fade counter on each permanent with fading you control.
card.flavor:
"The best I can offer is a temporary reprieve."
—Belbe

card.name: Parallax Nexus
card.ability:
Fading 5 (This enchantment enters the battlefield with five fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Remove a fade counter from Parallax Nexus: Target opponent exiles a card from his or her hand. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
When Parallax Nexus leaves the battlefield, each player returns to his or her hand all cards he or she owns exiled with Parallax Nexus.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The target opponent chooses which card to exile.

card.name: Parallax Tide
card.ability:
Fading 5 (This enchantment enters the battlefield with five fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Remove a fade counter from Parallax Tide: Exile target land.
When Parallax Tide leaves the battlefield, each player returns to the battlefield all cards he or she owns exiled with Parallax Tide.

card.name: Parallax Wave
card.ability:
Fading 5 (This enchantment enters the battlefield with five fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Remove a fade counter from Parallax Wave: Exile target creature.
When Parallax Wave leaves the battlefield, each player returns to the battlefield all cards he or she owns exiled with Parallax Wave.

card.name: Phyrexian Driver
card.ability: When Phyrexian Driver enters the battlefield, other Mercenary creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Although the abuse was initially effective, the troops soon became numb to it.

card.name: Phyrexian Prowler
card.ability:
Fading 3 (This creature enters the battlefield with three fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Remove a fade counter from Phyrexian Prowler: Phyrexian Prowler gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

card.name: Plague Witch
card.ability: {B}, {T}, Discard a card: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "I can ail what cures you."

card.name: Predator, Flagship
card.ability:
{2}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
{5}, {T}: Destroy target creature with flying.
card.flavor:
"The scourge of Skyshroud is airborne once more."
—Oracle en-Vec

card.name: Rackling
card.ability: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, Rackling deals X damage to that player, where X is 3 minus the number of cards in his or her hand.
card.flavor: "This may hurt a little."

card.name: Rathi Assassin
card.ability:
{1}{B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target tapped nonblack creature.
{3}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary permanent card with converted mana cost 3 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Rathi Fiend
card.ability:
When Rathi Fiend enters the battlefield, each player loses 3 life.
{3}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary permanent card with converted mana cost 3 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Rathi Intimidator
card.ability:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
{2}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary permanent card with converted mana cost 2 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Rath's Edge
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{4}, {T}, Sacrifice a land: Rath's Edge deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

card.name: Refreshing Rain
card.ability:
If an opponent controls a Swamp and you control a Forest, you may cast Refreshing Rain without paying its mana cost.
Target player gains 6 life.

card.name: Rejuvenation Chamber
card.ability:
Fading 2 (This artifact enters the battlefield with two fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
{T}: You gain 2 life.

card.name: Reverent Silence
card.ability:
If you control a Forest, rather than pay Reverent Silence's mana cost, you may have each other player gain 6 life.
Destroy all enchantments.

card.name: Rhox
card.ability:
You may have Rhox assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
{2}{G}: Regenerate Rhox. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.
4/1/2008 : When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
4/1/2008 : You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
4/1/2008 : If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

card.name: Rising Waters
card.ability:
Lands don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player untaps a land he or she controls.
card.flavor: Rising waters, sinking hope.

card.name: Rootwater Commando
card.ability: Islandwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls an Island.)
card.flavor: Rootwater merfolk are seldom seen these days, but elf corpses are as numerous as ever.

card.name: Rootwater Thief
card.ability:
{U}: Rootwater Thief gains flying until end of turn.
Whenever Rootwater Thief deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}. If you do, search that player's library for a card and exile it, then the player shuffles his or her library.

card.name: Rupture
card.ability: Sacrifice a creature. Rupture deals damage equal to that creature's power to each creature without flying and each player.
card.flavor: All creatures have an inner fire. Releasing it can be dangerous.

card.name: Rusting Golem
card.ability:
Fading 5 (This creature enters the battlefield with five fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Rusting Golem's power and toughness are each equal to the number of fade counters on it.

card.name: Saproling Burst
card.ability:
Fading 7 (This enchantment enters the battlefield with seven fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Remove a fade counter from Saproling Burst: Put a green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield. It has "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to the number of fade counters on Saproling Burst."
When Saproling Burst leaves the battlefield, destroy all tokens put onto the battlefield with Saproling Burst. They can't be regenerated.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Each token knows which Saproling Burst it came from.

card.name: Saproling Cluster
card.ability: {1}, Discard a card: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield. Any player may activate this ability.

card.name: Seahunter
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Search your library for a Merfolk permanent card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: "They can't feel pain. They just wiggle 'cause they're scared."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Seal of Cleansing
card.ability: Sacrifice Seal of Cleansing: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
card.flavor:
"I am the purifier, the light that clears all shadows."
—Seal inscription
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

card.name: Seal of Doom
card.ability: Sacrifice Seal of Doom: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"I am the banisher, the ill will that snuffs the final candle."
—Seal inscription

card.name: Seal of Fire
card.ability: Sacrifice Seal of Fire: Seal of Fire deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"I am the romancer, the passion that consumes the flesh."
—Seal inscription

card.name: Seal of Removal
card.ability: Sacrifice Seal of Removal: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
card.flavor:
"I am the unraveler, the loosened thread that will not hold."
—Seal inscription

card.name: Seal of Strength
card.ability: Sacrifice Seal of Strength: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"I am the feeder, the morsel that revives the starving."
—Seal inscription

card.name: Shrieking Mogg
card.ability:
Haste
When Shrieking Mogg enters the battlefield, tap all other creatures.
card.flavor: You have to admire its enthusiasm.

card.name: Silkenfist Fighter
card.ability: Whenever Silkenfist Fighter becomes blocked, untap it.
card.flavor:
Simple wooden staff
Made from life, protecting life,
Stronger than cold steel.

card.name: Silkenfist Order
card.ability: Whenever Silkenfist Order becomes blocked, untap it.
card.flavor:
Hands weave life and death;
Intertwining spirits knit
Tapestries and shrouds.

card.name: Sivvi's Ruse
card.ability:
If an opponent controls a Mountain and you control a Plains, you may cast Sivvi's Ruse without paying its mana cost.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt this turn to creatures you control.

card.name: Sivvi's Valor
card.ability:
If you control a Plains, you may tap an untapped creature you control rather than pay Sivvi's Valor's mana cost.
All damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn is dealt to you instead.

card.name: Skyshroud Behemoth
card.ability:
Fading 2 (This creature enters the battlefield with two fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Skyshroud Behemoth enters the battlefield tapped.

card.name: Skyshroud Claim
card.ability: Search your library for up to two Forest cards and put them onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: The forest's constant struggle is to keep the spreading flowstone at bay.

card.name: Skyshroud Cutter
card.ability: If you control a Forest, rather than pay Skyshroud Cutter's mana cost, you may have each other player gain 5 life.

card.name: Skyshroud Poacher
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Search your library for an Elf permanent card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: "It's OK. They're just elves."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You do not have to find an Elf card if you do not want to.

card.name: Skyshroud Ridgeback
card.ability: Fading 2 (This creature enters the battlefield with two fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)

card.name: Skyshroud Sentinel
card.ability: When Skyshroud Sentinel enters the battlefield, you may search your library for up to three cards named Skyshroud Sentinel, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

card.name: Sliptide Serpent
card.ability: {3}{U}: Return Sliptide Serpent to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: It's futile to fight something you can see only in the corner of your eye.

card.name: Sneaky Homunculus
card.ability: Sneaky Homunculus can't block or be blocked by creatures with power 2 or greater.
card.flavor: Keep watch only for the giants and you'll be eaten by the ants.

card.name: Spineless Thug
card.ability: Spineless Thug can't block.
card.flavor: These troops are only as strong as the evincar's control.

card.name: Spiritual Asylum
card.ability:
Creatures and lands you control have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
When a creature you control attacks, sacrifice Spiritual Asylum.
card.flavor: Trapped in safety is still trapped.

card.name: Spiteful Bully
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, Spiteful Bully deals 3 damage to target creature you control.
card.flavor: Like most creatures bent on total destruction, they rarely bother to double-check their targets.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It can damage itself. In fact, it has to if it is the only creature you control.

card.name: Stampede Driver
card.ability: {1}{G}, {T}, Discard a card: Creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain trample until end of turn.
card.flavor: "The thunder of hooves is music to my ears."

card.name: Stronghold Biologist
card.ability: {U}{U}, {T}, Discard a card: Counter target creature spell.
card.flavor: He twists the laws of nature until they scream.

card.name: Stronghold Discipline
card.ability: Each player loses 1 life for each creature he or she controls.
card.flavor:
"Crovax never passes up an opportunity to cause widespread misery."
—Belbe

card.name: Stronghold Gambit
card.ability: Each player chooses a card in his or her hand. Then each player reveals his or her chosen card. The owner of each creature card revealed this way with the lowest converted mana cost puts it onto the battlefield.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Creature cards which are revealed but are not the lowest cost, or any non-creature cards revealed remain in their owners' hands and stop being revealed.
10/4/2004 : You don't have to choose a creature card, but choosing a non creature does nothing except maybe bluff your opponent.

card.name: Stronghold Machinist
card.ability: {U}{U}, {T}, Discard a card: Counter target noncreature spell.
card.flavor: She stretches the laws of physics until they snap.

card.name: Stronghold Zeppelin
card.ability:
Flying
Stronghold Zeppelin can block only creatures with flying.
card.flavor: As long as the stronghold controlled the sky, the rebels were doomed.

card.name: Submerge
card.ability:
If an opponent controls a Forest and you control an Island, you may cast Submerge without paying its mana cost.
Put target creature on top of its owner's library.

card.name: Tangle Wire
card.ability:
Fading 4 (This artifact enters the battlefield with four fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player taps an untapped artifact, creature, or land he or she controls for each fade counter on Tangle Wire.

card.name: Terrain Generator
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{2}, {T}: You may put a basic land card from your hand onto the battlefield tapped.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Putting a land onto the battlefield this way does not count as your one land play for the turn.
5/1/2007 : Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional.  When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.

card.name: Topple
card.ability: Exile target creature with the greatest power. (If two or more creatures are tied for greatest power, target any one of them.)
card.flavor:
"Let all witness the fate of those who defy me."
—Crovax
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It can only target a creature with the greatest power. This means you pick such a creature on announcement, and if that creature is not still the one with greatest power on resolution, then this spell is countered since its target is illegal.

card.name: Treetop Bracers
card.ability:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.
card.flavor: Gravity is truly what you make of it.
card.ruling: 5/1/2007 : Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) don’t actually have Flying, so they can’t block a creature enchanted with this.

card.name: Trickster Mage
card.ability: {U}, {T}, Discard a card: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
card.flavor: "If it ain't broke, I'll break it. If it is broke, I'll fix it."

card.name: Vicious Hunger
card.ability: Vicious Hunger deals 2 damage to target creature and you gain 2 life.
card.flavor:
"Blood is foul, the flesh dross. My ascendance thirsts for life itself."
—Crovax

card.name: Viseling
card.ability: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, Viseling deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of cards in his or her hand minus 4.
card.flavor: "This may hurt a lot."

card.name: Voice of Truth
card.ability: Flying, protection from white
card.flavor:
"Above them all is Truth, and Truth must be set free. If the wings of Truth are clipped, the voices will fall silent."
—Song of All, canto 167

card.name: Volrath the Fallen
card.ability: {1}{B}, Discard a creature card: Volrath the Fallen gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the discarded card's converted mana cost.
card.flavor: "I stepped out. I did not step down."

card.name: Wandering Eye
card.ability:
Flying
Players play with their hands revealed.
card.flavor: The evincar has many ways of keeping track of his subjects.

card.name: Wild Mammoth
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, if a player controls more creatures than each other player, the player who controls the most creatures gains control of Wild Mammoth.
card.flavor: "Sit. Heel Down HELP"

card.name: Woodripper
card.ability:
Fading 3 (This creature enters the battlefield with three fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
{1}, Remove a fade counter from Woodripper: Destroy target artifact.
